title: Healing
data:
***Version [0.18](/0.18 "0.18")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Healing** is the act of restoring lost [HP](/HP "HP"). All characters need to heal when combat wears them out, preferably in a hurry, but not all methods of healings are suitable for all characters. The following is a list of all means of HP recovery:

## Contents

- [1 Healing Naturally](#Healing_Naturally)
- [2 Healing Through Spells](#Healing_Through_Spells)
- [3 Divine Healing](#Divine_Healing)
- [4 Healing Through Items](#Healing_Through_Items)
- [5 Species-specific Healing](#Species-specific_Healing)
- [6 Amulet of Guardian Spirit](#Amulet_of_Guardian_Spirit)

## Healing Naturally

- Injured characters recover HP over time, allowing you to recover after combat by simply standing around. You can pass a single turn by pressing **.** or up to 100 turns by pressing **5**. The amount you recover is based upon your character's [regeneration rate](/Regeneration_rate "Regeneration rate").

  - Be aware that [trolls](/Troll "Troll"), well-fed [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire"), and [vine stalkers](/Vine_stalker "Vine stalker") recover HP faster than normal this way, while [deep dwarves](/Deep_dwarves "Deep dwarves") and bloodless vampires won't recover HP from resting at all.
  - Wearing an [amulet of regeneration](/Amulet_of_regeneration "Amulet of regeneration"), [troll leather armour](/Troll_leather_armour "Troll leather armour"), [artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") with the Regeneration intrinsic, or having the [Regeneration](/Good_mutations#Regeneration "Good mutations") [mutation](/Mutation "Mutation") increase your regeneration rate.
  - By contrast, having the [Slow Healing](/Slow_Healing "Slow Healing") mutation decrease your regeneration rate whenever monsters are around.

## Healing Through Spells

- The [Regeneration](/Regeneration "Regeneration") spell gives you a temporary but massive boost to your regeneration rate, allowing you to recover quickly.
- The [Vampiric Draining](/Vampiric_Draining "Vampiric Draining") spell allows you to steal HP from adjacent living enemies.
- The [Borgnjor's Revivification](/Borgnjor%27s_Revivification "Borgnjor's Revivification") spell immediately recovers all your HP, but casting it permanently reduces your max HP by a small amount.

## Divine Healing

- [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon")'s abilities allow you to directly heal yourself or others.
- [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag")'s Potion Petition ability may give you the chance to buy a healing potion.
- [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb")'s followers may recover HP each time they kill a monster.
- [Ru](/Ru "Ru")'s Draw Out Power ability restores some HP at the cost of [draining](/Drain "Drain") you.
- [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One")'s Followers may regain HP and MP each time they kill a demonic or undead monster.
- [Trog](/Trog "Trog")'s Trog's Hand ability temporarily increases your regeneration rate, along with its other benefits.
- [Xom](/Xom "Xom") occasionally decides to heal you when [tension](/Tension "Tension") is high.
- [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s Drain Life ability injures all living monsters around you, granting half of the damage dealt as healing to you.

## Healing Through Items

- Some attacks against appropriate enemies made with a [vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") weapon heal the wielder for half the damage dealt.

- [Potions](/Potions "Potions")

  - [Quaffing](/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing") restores 1d7+4 HP, along with its other benefits.
  - Quaffing a [potion of heal wounds](/Potion_of_heal_wounds "Potion of heal wounds") restores 3d28/3+9 HP.
  - Quaffing a [potion of ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia") gives you several turns of increased HP and MP regeneration, but also [confuses](/Confusion "Confusion") you while you're regenerating.
    - Bloodless [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") and [ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul") cannot regenerate while monsters are visible. [Mummies](/Mummies "Mummies") are unable to quaff potions. [Vine Stalkers](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") cannot regain HP from potions.

- [Decks](/Decks "Decks")

  - Drawing the [Potion card](/Potion_card "Potion card") from a [deck of changes](/Deck_of_changes "Deck of changes"), [war](/Deck_of_war "Deck of war"), or [defence](/Deck_of_defence "Deck of defence") has a chance to restore you as though you'd drank a potion of curing or heal wounds.
  - Drawing the [Elixir card](/Elixir_card "Elixir card") from a deck of changes, war, defence, or [escape](/Deck_of_escape "Deck of escape") greatly increases your regeneration for several turns.
  - Drawing the [Alchemist card](/Alchemist_card "Alchemist card") from a deck of changes, defence, escape, or [wonders](/Deck_of_wonders "Deck of wonders") restores HP in exchange for some [gold](/Gold "Gold").

- [Wands](/Wands "Wands")
  - Zapping yourself with a [wand of heal wounds](/Wand_of_heal_wounds "Wand of heal wounds") restores 3d28/3+9 HP.
    - [Vine Stalkers](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") and characters wearing the [Robe of Vines](/Robe_of_Vines "Robe of Vines") cannot heal from wands.

## Species-specific Healing

- [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") with the [Powered by Death](/Demonspawn_mutations#Powered_by_Death "Demonspawn mutations") [mutation](/Mutation "Mutation") have a higher regeneration rate when near fresh corpses.
- [Ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul") can recover current and max HP by eating [chunks](/Chunk "Chunk").
- Hungry vampires recover some HP and [satiation](/Satiation "Satiation") each time they successfully [stab](/Stabbing "Stabbing") a living enemy.

## Amulet of Guardian Spirit

- [Guardian spirit](/Guardian_spirit "Guardian spirit") causes all damage taken by your character to be split between HP and [MP](/MP "MP") until your MP reaches 0. Characters that don't use MP normally can treat this as additional HP, and enjoy a bonus to regeneration rate because both HP and MP regenerate separately.

  - Quaffing [potions of magic](/Potions_of_magic "Potions of magic") or using [channeling](/Channeling "Channeling") (excellent for mummy or [lichform](/Lichform "Lichform") characters) are effective means of "healing" characters with this amulet.
  - Deep dwarves have difficulty taking advantage of this amulet, as their MP regeneration rate is set to 0 when they equip it. However, any of the above methods of restoring MP still function.
